lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/main.main.java.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run main.main.java.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* AddDeadline is a command which adds a deadline task to the task list.
* @param description it should contain the deadline description and the date
* Adds the deadline into the task list.
* @param storage the storage for the saved task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
throw new DukeException("Your add deadline command is incomplete.");
throw new DukeException("There is an error in adding the Deadline task to your saved data.");
throw new DukeException("Please provide the time in YYYY-MM-DD HHMM format instead.");
* AddEvent is a command which adds an event task to the task list.
* @param description it should contain the event description and the date
* Adds the event into the task list.
* @param storage the storage for the saved task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
throw new DukeException("Your add event command is incomplete.");
throw new DukeException("There is an error in adding the Event task to your saved data.");
throw new DukeException("Please provide the time in YYYY-MM-DD HHMM format instead.");
* AddTodo is a command which adds a ToDo task to the task list.
* @param description it should contain the ToDo description and the date
* Adds the ToDo into the task list.
* @param storage the storage for the saved task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
throw new DukeException("The description for the Todo task cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException("There is an error in adding the Todo task to your saved data.");
* Bye is a command which closes the Duke bot and its readers.
* Closes the Ui and all its readers.
* @param storage the storage for the saved task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Returns true if this command is executed.
* This is an abstract class of all the Commands that Duke can perform.
* @param description it should contain more instructions for the command
* Adds the relevant actions pertaining to the command.
* @param storage the storage for the saved task list
protected abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Returns true if it is a bye command and returns false otherwise
* @return boolean of whether this is the last command or not
* Deadline is a task that has a date to be done by.
public Deadline(boolean isDone, String description, String date) {
* Returns the string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return the string representation of the Deadline task
return "[D]" + super.toString() + "(by: " + DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMM uuuu hh:mma").format(this.date) + ")";
* Returns if the task date is equal to the date provided.
* @return true if they are both equal
* Delete is a command which deletes a specific Task from the TaskList.
* @param description it should contain index of the task to be deleted
* Deletes the task from the task list.
* @param storage the storage for the saved task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
throw new DukeException("There is no such task in existence.");
throw new DukeException("There is an error in deleting from your saved data.");
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
throw new DukeException("Your date (YYYY-MM-DD) / date & time (YYYY-MM-DD HHMM) (24h) is given in the wrong format!");
throw new DukeException("There is no such task in existence.");
throw new DukeException("There is an error reflecting the task as done in the saved data.");
* Duke is a Personal Assistant Chatbot that helps a person
* DukeException encapsulates all the exceptions that could occur from Duke.
* @param errorMessage indicates the error that has occurred
* Event is a task that has a date in which it is happening.
public Event(boolean isDone, String description, String date) {
* Returns the string representation of the Deadline task.
* @return the string representation of the Deadline task
return "[E]" + super.toString() + "(at: " + DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("d MMM uuuu hh:mma").format(this.date) + ")";
* Returns if the task date is equal to the date provided.
* @return true if they are both equal
* Invalid is a command that is invalid.
* @param description it should not contain any description.
* @param storage the storage for the saved task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* List is a command which prints out all the Tasks in the list, and even
* prints only tasks of a specific date if the date is specified.
* @param description it is either empty, or contains a date for which tasks with that date should be returned.
* Lists down all the tasks (of the specified date).
* @param storage the storage for the saved task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
throw new DukeException("Your date (YYYY-MM-DD) / date & time (YYYY-MM-DD HHMM) (24h) is given in the wrong format!");
* Parser reads the input by the user and returns the relevant command.
* Reads the fullCommand and return the relevant command.
* Storage is in-charge of loading the saved taskList, and updating it.
* @param filePath the specified path of the file.
* Loads the file and initialises the TaskList.
* @throws IOException if there is an issue with writing/reading the file
* Change the string in the storage file to indicate that the task is done.
* @param index the position of the item
* @throws IOException if there is an error writing to the file
protected void setDone(int index) throws IOException {

* @param description the description of the task
* @param date        the date of the task (if deadline or event)
* @throws IOException if there is an error writing to the file
protected void add(String type, String description, String date) throws IOException {
* Deletes the task from the storage file.
* @param index the position of the task in the list
* @throws IOException if there is an error writing to the file
protected void delete(int index) throws IOException {
* A task contains its description and information of whether it is done or not.
* Returns the status icon of the task.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return the string representation of the task
* Returns if the task date is equal to the date provided.
* @return true if they are both equal
* TaskList stores the list of tasks.
private static final String ADD = "\t Got it. I've added this task:";
private static final String LIST_INTRO = "\t Here are the tasks in your list:";
private static final String DONE = "\t Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n\t   ";
private static final String DELETE = "\t Noted. I've removed this task:\n\t   ";
* Adds the task into the list.
* @param task the task to be added into the list
System.out.println("\t Now you have 1 task in the list.");
System.out.println("\t Now you have " + this.LIST.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Setter to change the done status of the task.
* Delete the task at a specified index.
* Prints Tasks on the specified date.
if (count == 0) System.out.println("There are no tasks pertaining to the specified date.");
* Return the number of items in the TaskList.
* ToDo is a task that doesnt have any dates tied to it.
* Returns the string representation of the ToDo task.
* @return the string representation of the ToDO task
* Returns if the task date is equal to the date provided.
* @return true if they are both equal
* Ui deals with all the interactions with the user.
private static final String INTRO = "Hello! I'm Duke\n\t What can I do for you?";
private static final String BYE_MESSAGE = "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* @param str the String to be formatted
throw new DukeException("Unable to close the parser.");
